definitions: healthcare professional who examines eyes for vision problems and prescribes corrective lenses
examples: The optometrist recommended progressive lenses for better reading
Schedule your annual eye exam with the optometrist

definitions: state of great wealth and luxury characterized by expensive and lavish possessions
examples: The palace displayed opulence with its gold furnishings
They lived in opulence after inheriting the fortune

definitions: person or shrine in ancient times believed to speak divine prophecies
person regarded as a source of wise counsel or prophetic information
examples: Ancient Greeks consulted the oracle at Delphi for guidance
The oracle predicted victory in the upcoming battle
She became the oracle of fashion in the industry
Investors treat him like an oracle on market trends

definitions: large reddish-brown ape with long arms native to rainforests of Borneo and Sumatra
examples: The orangutan swung gracefully through the forest canopy
Conservation efforts protect orangutan habitats from deforestation

definitions: formal speech delivered on a ceremonial occasion expressing important ideas with dignity
examples: The president delivered a powerful oration at the memorial
Her graduation oration inspired the entire audience deeply

definitions: person skilled in public speaking who delivers speeches with eloquence and persuasion
examples: The orator captivated audiences with his powerful delivery
She trained as an orator in debate competitions

definitions: large-scale musical work for orchestra and voices typically based on religious themes without staging
examples: Handel's Messiah remains the most famous oratorio ever composed
The choir performed the oratorio at the cathedral

definitions: skill and practice of formal public speaking with eloquence and persuasion
small chapel or room used for private prayer and worship
examples: His oratory skills helped him win the election
She studied oratory to become a better presenter
The monks gathered in the oratory for evening prayers
A small oratory stood beside the main church

definitions: round three-dimensional object or celestial body shaped like a ball or sphere
examples: The crystal orb reflected light throughout the room
Earth appears as a blue orb from space

definitions: spacecraft designed to orbit around a planet or moon without landing on it
examples: The Mars orbiter sent back detailed surface images
NASA launched a new orbiter to study Jupiter

definitions: large black and white marine mammal also known as killer whale found in all oceans
examples: The orca pod hunted together in coordinated attacks
Tourists watched orcas breach near the boat

definitions: area of land planted with fruit trees arranged in rows for commercial production
examples: The apple orchard bloomed beautifully in early spring
They picked fresh peaches from the orchard

definitions: large group of musicians playing various instruments together typically including strings, woodwinds, brass, and percussion
examples: The symphony orchestra performed Beethoven's Fifth magnificently tonight
She plays violin in the school orchestra

definitions: arrangement of music for performance by an orchestra with parts for different instruments
careful organization of complex elements or activities to achieve desired results
examples: The orchestration highlighted the woodwind section beautifully throughout
His orchestration of Gershwin's piano works was masterful
The event required careful orchestration of multiple vendors
Her orchestration of the merger impressed the board

definitions: person who arranges music for orchestral performance or organizes complex activities and events
examples: The orchestrator adapted the film score for concert performance
She acted as orchestrator of the international conference

definitions: tropical plant with showy, often fragrant flowers having complex shapes and vivid colors
examples: The purple orchid bloomed for several weeks continuously
She cultivated rare orchids in her greenhouse collection

definitions: very unpleasant or painful experience that tests a person's endurance and character
examples: The mountain rescue became a three-day ordeal
Survivors described their ordeal during the hurricane

definitions: process or result of arranging things in a particular sequence or structured pattern
examples: The alphabetical ordering made finding names much easier
Computer ordering of inventory improved warehouse efficiency

definitions: hospital employee who assists with non-medical patient care and maintains ward cleanliness
examples: The orderly helped transfer patients to different rooms
An orderly brought fresh linens to the ward

definitions: number denoting position in a sequence such as first, second, or third
examples: Students learned ordinal numbers in their math lesson
The ordinal ranking showed her in fifth place

definitions: law or regulation enacted by a municipal government to govern matters within its jurisdiction
examples: The city passed an ordinance banning plastic bags
Noise ordinances restrict loud music after ten o'clock

definitions: formal religious ceremony conferring holy orders to make someone a priest, minister, or rabbi
examples: His ordination ceremony took place at the cathedral
Friends gathered to celebrate her ordination as minister

definitions: military weapons and ammunition including artillery, bombs, and other explosive devices
examples: The army depot stored ordnance in reinforced bunkers
Unexploded ordnance posed dangers years after the war

definitions: naturally occurring rock or mineral from which metal or valuable minerals can be extracted
examples: Miners extracted iron ore from the mountain deposits
The copper ore yielded high-quality metal after processing

definitions: aromatic Mediterranean herb with small leaves used dried or fresh in cooking
examples: Pizza sauce needs oregano for authentic Italian flavor
Fresh oregano grew abundantly in the herb garden

definitions: popular cookie consisting of two chocolate wafers with sweet cream filling between them
examples: Children love dunking Oreos in cold milk
The recipe called for crushed Oreos as topping

definitions: group of people working together in a structured way for a shared purpose
examples: The organisation promoted environmental conservation through education programs
She joined an organisation dedicated to helping refugees

definitions: person who arranges and coordinates events, activities, or groups of people systematically
examples: The event organiser handled every detail perfectly throughout
As chief organiser, she coordinated all the volunteers

definitions: musician who plays the organ, especially in churches or concert halls
examples: The church organist played beautiful hymns every Sunday
A skilled organist performed Bach's famous toccata

definitions: person who arranges and coordinates events, activities, or groups of people
container or system designed to arrange and store items in orderly fashion
examples: The conference organizer managed hundreds of attendees smoothly
As union organizer, he recruited new members effectively
Buy a desk organizer to keep supplies neatly arranged
The closet organizer maximized storage space significantly

definitions: intense pleasurable sensation occurring at the peak of sexual arousal and release
examples: Physical and emotional factors both affect orgasm intensity
Medical conditions can sometimes interfere with achieving orgasm

definitions: wild party or event involving excessive indulgence in specified activities, often of sexual nature
examples: Ancient Roman orgies became legendary for their excess
The shopping spree turned into an orgy of spending

definitions: countries of Asia, especially East Asia, collectively regarded from a Western perspective
examples: Traders brought silk and spices from the Orient
European explorers sought new routes to the Orient

definitions: opening or hole in the body or in a hollow organ through which something passes
examples: The doctor examined each orifice during the checkup
Natural orifices allow substances to enter or exit

definitions: Japanese art of folding paper into decorative shapes and figures without cutting
examples: She created beautiful origami cranes for the wedding
Children learned origami techniques in art class today

definitions: quality of being novel, creative, or unique rather than imitative or conventional
examples: The artist's originality earned international recognition and awards
Publishers seek manuscripts that show true originality

definitions: process of bringing something into existence or initiating a new development or system
examples: The loan origination process took several weeks altogether
Her idea led to the origination of the program

definitions: person who creates, initiates, or brings something new into existence
examples: The originator of the theory won the Nobel Prize
As originator of the plan, she received full credit

definitions: brightly colored songbird with black and yellow or orange plumage found in temperate regions
examples: Baltimore orioles nested in the old oak tree
The oriole's melodious song filled the morning air

definitions: object used to make something look more attractive but having no practical purpose
examples: Glass ornaments decorated the Christmas tree beautifully tonight
She collected ceramic ornaments from different countries

definitions: plant grown primarily for its decorative features rather than for food or materials
examples: Ornamental grasses added texture to the landscape design
The garden featured several ornamental flowering shrubs

definitions: decorative elements added to something to make it more elaborate or attractive
examples: Baroque architecture featured elaborate ornamentation on every surface
The dress had minimal ornamentation for elegant simplicity

definitions: scientist who studies birds including their behavior, ecology, classification, and conservation
examples: The ornithologist identified over fifty species during migration
As an ornithologist, she specialized in tropical birds

definitions: scientific study of birds including their physiology, behavior, ecology, and evolution
examples: She earned her doctorate in ornithology from Cornell
Ornithology field guides help identify different bird species

definitions: child whose parents are dead or have permanently abandoned them
examples: The orphan found a loving home with relatives
Many orphans lived together in the children's home

definitions: residential institution dedicated to the care and education of children without parents
examples: The orphanage provided shelter for hundreds of children
Volunteers taught classes at the local orphanage

definitions: authorized or generally accepted theory, doctrine, or practice within a particular domain
examples: Religious orthodoxy shaped the community's daily practices completely
Scientific orthodoxy eventually accepted the revolutionary new theory
